data.text: Be not hasty with thy mouth,
For through the multitude of trial a dream comes;
Whenever thou shalt vow a vow to God,
It is better that thou shouldest not vow,
Suffer not thy mouth to lead thy flesh to sin;
For there is evil in a multitude of dreams and vanities and many words:
If thou shouldest see the oppression of the poor, and the wresting of judgment and of justice in the land,
Also the abundance of the earth is for everyone:
He that loves silver shall not be satisfied with silver:
In the multitude of good they are increased that eat it:
The sleep of a servant is sweet,
There is an infirmity which I have seen under the sun,
And that wealth shall perish in an evil trouble:
As he came forth naked from his motherâ€™s womb,
And this is also an evil infirmity:
Yea, all his days are in darkness, and in mourning,
Behold, I have seen good, that it is a fine thing for a man
Yea, and as for every man to whom God has given
For he shall not much remember the days of his life;
